newsitem.title: UK: RANK PREPARING TO SELL XEROX - PAPER.
newsitem.headline: RANK PREPARING TO SELL XEROX - PAPER.

text.p: Rank Group Plc is preparing to sell its stake in Rank Xerox, the Financial Times said on Thursday.
The newspaper said the stake was valued at 930 million stg ($1.5 billion)on Rank's books and Xerox Corp was the most likely buyer.
The Financial Times said Rank had made changes to its internal tax structure enabling it to sell the 20 percent stake in Rank Xerox without incurring a hefty capital gains tax bill.

Separately, Rank said on Wednesday it would sell its film distribution unit to Carlton Communications Plc in a 65 million stg deal that sealed Rank's transition from "golden era" movie-maker to modern film services firm.
The sale completed Rank's disposal of 300 million stg worth of non-core assets about 10 months ahead of schedule.
"Our Film and Entertainment Services division is now clearly focused on serving the film industry, primarily the major Hollywood studios," said Rank's chief executive Andrew Teare.
-- Dan Lalor, London Newsroom +44 171 542 8863 ($ = 0.606 British Pounds)
